Cursor AI Editor Complete Review 2026

The AI-First Code Editor: Worth the Hype?

What is Cursor?

Cursor is an AI-first code editor built as a fork of Visual Studio Code. It integrates AI capabilities directly into the editor, offering features like intelligent code completion, chat interface, and codebase-wide understanding.

Key Features

  • AI Code Completion: Context-aware suggestions as you type
  • Chat Interface: Ask questions about your codebase
  • Codebase Awareness: Understands your entire project
  • Multi-file Editing: Make changes across multiple files
  • VS Code Compatible: Use all your favorite extensions
  • Local Privacy: Option to use local AI models

Pricing

Free

$0

  • • Basic AI features
  • • Limited GPT-4 usage
  • • Community support

Pro

$20/mo

  • • Unlimited fast GPT-4
  • • Advanced features
  • • Priority support

Business

$40/user/mo

  • • Everything in Pro
  • • Admin controls
  • • SSO & security

Pros and Cons

Pros

  • Familiar VS Code interface
  • Powerful AI integration
  • Fast performance
  • Regular updates
  • Free tier available
  • Active development

Cons

  • Still in beta
  • Requires internet for AI features
  • Learning curve for AI features
  • Occasional bugs
  • Can be resource-intensive

Cursor vs Copilot

Better than Copilot:

  • More context awareness
  • Better codebase understanding
  • Built-in chat interface
  • Can use local models
